detaileddescription.para: PIT CHAIN mask.

Mask applied to the register address for IDS_PIT_CHANNEL channel and used for setting 32bits address. Also used in the context of starting the IDS time.
Value 0x05u.
Ubatt sample representing that Ubatt is in low value.

Used in the context of computing the voltage exception needed for the master state machine and computing the current voltage exception based on the battery voltage.
range uint8 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context CentANDCheckUbattRanges protection none storage class init ram
Variable representing the reason for HAL destructive reset.

Used to store the pointer to the "MC_RGM" (Reset Generation Module) peripheral register destination variable representing the HAL destructive reset reason.
range uint32 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context Hal_StoreRegDestResetReason, Hal_GetDestResetReason protection none storage class init ram
Variable representinng the reason for HAL functional reset.

Used to store the pointer to the "MC_RGM" (Reset Generation Module) peripheral register destination variable representing the HAL functional reset reason.
range uint32 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context Hal_StoreRegDestResetReason, Hal_GetFunctionalResetReason protection none storage class init ram
Helper function for getting the wakeup EcuM reason.

By calling HalIsLowPowerToHighPowerWakeup() function, get the returned value. This returned value represents if there should be a transition from low power mode to high power wakeup.
N/A
N/A
void
EcuM_WakeupSourceType
Globals N/A
N/A
reentrant No context Model task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
The test method is described in: Test case shall be created to check if after calling HalIsLowPowerToHighPowerWakeup function the correct value is returned. TEST_GetWakeupEcuMSrc
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function that gets the flag that represents if a transition from low power mode to high power wakeup was done.
Helper function. This callback routine must be implemented for the USM to dispatch the wakeup frame to the according USM FSM

Defined in c function because it is a callback neded by Can.h.
To be called after HAL_SetActiveConfigSet
N/A
cbd
- represents pointer to CAN telegram range const TCanRxFifoElem * resolution N/A unit N/A
void
Globals
ui32_WakeUpMessageID [out] WakeUpMessageBus [out] NMH_MESSAGE_MASK [in] NMH_MESSAGE_BASE_ADDRESS [in] CarWakeUpOpenFilter [out] OpenFilterMode [in] ui32_WakeUpMessageID will store the ID for the wakeup message. WakeUpMessageBus used to store the bus for the wake up message. NMH_MESSAGE_MASK and NMH_MESSAGE_BASE_ADDRESS are MQB-specific defines used to determinate if CarWakeUpOpenFilter will be updated or not. CarWakeUpOpenFilter store the value of CarWakeup signal from the wake up message. OpenFilterMode is a fag for open filters mode.
reentrant No context task Model Task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous

Test Method
The test method is described in: Test case shall be created to check if the correct state is returned after calling HalIsLowPowerToHighPowerWakeup() function. TEST_hal_common__CanOpenFilterCallback
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. To dispatch the wakeup frame to the according USM FSM.

Reset Generation Module return function.

Gets the pointer to the "MC_RGM" (Reset Generation Module) peripheral. The Reset Generation Module (MC_RGM) is a complex state machine that begins sequencing the SPC58xEx/SPC58xGx through the initial steps of the reset process.

Helper function to stop PIT.

Stop PIT peripheral/stop OS timers. Stop the PIT_0 - channels and clear possible active IR-flags in order to allow the ME to go to standby-mode.
The OS timers are stopped. The tasks on the core1, core0 will no longer be executed.
N/A
N/A
void
void
Globals
CH[0].TCTRL.R [in] CH[1].TCTRL.R [in] CH[2].TCTRL.R [in] CH[3].TCTRL.R [in] CH[4].TCTRL.R [in] CH[5].TCTRL.R [in] CH[6].TCTRL.R [in] CH[7].TCTRL.R [in] CH[0].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[1].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[2].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[3].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[4].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[5].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[6].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[7].TFLG.B.TIF [in] CH[].TCTRL.R and CH[].TFLG.B.TIF represent the channels for the registers for PIT module.
reentrant No context model Task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous

RTC (Real Time Clock) HAL stop watch function.

Function that gets the internal RTC counter value (ticks at 16MHz).
RTC_API clock frequence is 16MHz. It overflows in about 4 minutes. Please make sure the overflow is considered.

uint32

Helper function to disable secondary cores.

Mark core1, core0 and HSM as inactive for the next Mcu mode transition. Before the transition to Standby is done, all cores except Core 2 are to be stopped. If this is not done sporadically on a wakeup from Standby Core1 or Core 0 are already starting while Core 2 is in initialization of the RAMs. Here obviously the DMA is disturbed and doesn't do it's work. The complete system doesn't startup properly.
N/A
Call Mcu_SetMode
void
void
Globals
CCTL1.R [in] CCTL3.R [in] CCTL4.R [in] CCTL1.R represents the core_0. CCTL3.R represents the core_1. CCTL4.R represents the HSM core.
reentrant No context model Task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
The test method is described in: Test case shall be created to check if core_0, core_1 and HSM core are stopped. TEST_HAL_SecondaryCores_Disable
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Needed by Prepare_Ports_ForSleepMode to disable all secondary cores.
Check if NvM data stored in Standby RAM is valid.

The NvM state needs to be consistent after wakeup with previous pending jobs finalized. The NvM data is being stored in standby RAM for faster wakeup. NvM state needs to be consistent during initialization.
N/A
The ECU goes to sleep.
void
void
Globals
NvM_Manager.MultiJob [in] NvM_Manager.Std.State [in] NVM_MULTIBLOCK_NOJOB [in] NVM_NO_REQ [in] Fee_NvmJob [out] NvM_Manager.MultiJob and NvM_Manager.Std.State are Nvm data and will be checked if they are valid by comparing them to NVM_MULTIBLOCK_NOJOB and NVM_NO_REQ. Fee_NvmJob is the job for NvM Request and at the end of the function it will be initialized to 0.
reentrant No context task Model Task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
The test method is described in: Test case shall be created to check if Nvm data stored in Standby RAM is valid or not. TEST_NvM_StandbyData_UpdateStatus
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function used to check if Nvm data stored is valid. the NvM data to beis stored in standby RAM for faster wakeup. NvM state is needs to be consistent during initialization.
Start the timers for IDS.

PIT Channels 4 and 5 are chained. The first one makes a prescaling to 1 ms. The second one counts the ms. It is used to record the timestamp for the UDP Tunnel.
N/A
N/A
void
void
Globals
IDS_PIT_CHANNEL_Prescaler [in] OS_CLOCK_VALUE [in] IDS_PIT_CHANNEL [in] PIT_LDVAL_MAX_VALUE [in] PIT_CHAIN [in] Channel IDS_PIT_CHANNEL_Prescaler makes a prescaling to 1ms and OS_CLOCK_VALUE represents the value that will be loaded in the OSTM couter register. Channel IDS_PIT_CHANNEL counts the ms. PIT_LDVAL_MAX_VALUE is the highest possible loading value for PIT channels. PIT_CHAIN is a mask and is applied to the register address for IDS_PIT_CHANNEL channel and used for setting 32bits address.
reentrant No context model Task thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
The test method is described in: Test case shall be created to check if the timers for IDS are started. TEST_StartIDSTime
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Needed in the context of startup control for ICAS1.

briefdescription.para: Source file for HAL common part.

detaileddescription.para: Contains implementation of functions that need low level access common to all Chorus uC types.
